column1: #Text=Leaked emails show UK RAF were aware of Nimrod problems prior to fatal crash

#Text=Leaked emails have revealed that the United Kingdom 's Royal Air Force ( RAF ) were aware of a dangerous problem with fuel leaking from Nimrod MR2 surveillance aircraft long before one exploded in midair during a mission in Kandahar , Afghanistan .
#Text=All 14 people on board were killed in the crash in September last year .

#Text=Graham Knight , father of Sergeant Ben Knight , who died in the accident aged 25 , told reporters that he had received internal RAF emails detailing prior concerns about the fuel leak problems on the Nimrod .

#Text=One email originally sent on December 2 , 2005 commented that “ XV230 [ the tail number of the Nimrod that would go on to crash ] has fuel-leak issues which need to be rectified before the aircraft can be deployed . ”

#Text=Another , from February 2006 , had the following to say : “ The age of the airframe , combined with the aggressive tempo with which we are flying the jets in stark temperature shifts , is contributing to our leak headache . ”
#Text=Another email later the same month highlighted the serious nature of the problem :
#Text=“ Fuel leaks on the Nimrod MR2 aircraft now pose a significant threat to the force being able to meet commitments and operational tasking . ”
#Text=The emails were quietly forwarded to Knight , who has gone public with them via Sky News .
#Text=“ I have evidence that a fuel leak caused the crash and the Service was fully aware of the risk months beforehand .
#Text=I believe the RAF killed my son , ” he said .
#Text=He said that the emails were all written by senior members of the RAF , adding “ there are so many people within the organisation who are not happy with what has been going on . ”
#Text=" The more I have dug , the deeper the conspiracy gets - essentially , I think the major failures have been down to communication problems .
